idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.1850

descript.abstract: United States 111th Congressional Districts represents the political boundaries for the U.S. 111th congressional districts. The membership is current as of February 25, 2009.
descript.purpose: United States 111th Congressional Districts provides the locations of congressional districts, primarily for national planning applications.
descript.supplinf:
Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:1,000,000.
This dataset comes with an ESRI layer file representing the party affiliation of the congressman.

cntinfo.cntinst:

For support, you may contact ESRI Support Center by telephone (voice) between 5:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com/; ESRI holidays excluded.
Outside the United States- Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local ESRI Office. This information can be found at http://www.esri.com/company/locations.html.
For other questions or comments, you may contact ESRI headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

cntorgp.cntorg: Research Data Services (RDS), Columbia University Libraries

enttyp.enttypd: An area established by state officials or the courts for the purpose of electing a person to the U.S. House of Representatives. Within each state, these areas must contain, as nearly as possible, an equal number of inhabitants. The number of congressional districts in each state may change after each decennial census, and the boundaries may be changed more than once during a decade.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The name of the representative for the congressional district.
attr.attrdefs: Clerk of the U.S. House of Representatives

attr.attrdef: The political party of the representative for the congressional district.
attr.attrdefs: Clerk of the U.S. House of Representatives

edom.edomvd: The representative has resigned, died, or declined to serve.

attr.attrdef: The two-letter abbreviation for the state in which the congressional district is located.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The 2008 estimated population of the congressional district.
The area of the congressional district in square miles.

digtinfo.formspec: The SDC file contains the geospatial and attribute data. The SDI file contains the spatial index. The PRJ file contains the coordinate system information (optional). The XML file (*.sdc.xml) contains the metadata describing the data set (optional).

stdorder.ordering: ESRI Data & Maps is available only as part of ESRI software.

distinfo.techpreq: To use this data requires software that supports SDC files.

serinfo.issue: 2008 World, Europe, United States, Canada, and Mexico

citeinfo.title: 2006 Second Edition TIGER/Line Files; 110th Congressional Districts, 2010
citeinfo.geoform: tabular digital data; vector digital data
citeinfo.othercit: Provided the congressional district boundaries for Pennsylvania, Georgia, and Texas. Provided a correction to Hawaii.

citeinfo.origin: Clerk of the U.S. House of Representatives
citeinfo.title: MEMBER INFORMATION

pubinfo.publish: Clerk of the U.S. House of Representatives

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by ESRI: Copied the ESRI Data & Maps 2008 Update U.S. 110th Congressional Districts shapefile. Verified that there were no boundary changes. Compared NAME and PARTY attribute values to information at http://clerk.house.gov/member_info/olm111.html, and updated any necessary values. Added POP2008 from ESRI Data. Converted the data set to SDC. Created projection file (.prj) and spatial indices.

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using either tools in ArcGIS or ESRI SDC Data Development Kit Professional 2 (DDKP2). The SDC data set is then imported into a file geodatabase to verify and validate the geometry.
dataqual.complete:
After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.
Line simplification and smoothing was performed with a tolerance of 0.005 decimal degrees and a coordinate reduction using the Douglas-Peucker method with a tolerance of 0.0003 decimal degrees. Very small polygons were eliminated when the combination of geographic codes existed elsewhere.
